info.title: LogoKit Logo API
info.description: The LogoKit Logo API allows you to retrieve company logos by domain, providing high-quality PNG images via hotlinking. Supports fallback options and attribution for free users.

get.description: Returns the logo for the specified domain as a PNG image. Free users: 64x64px. Paid users: 128x128px. Caching or local storage of images is not supported.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The domain for which to retrieve the logo.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Publishable API token for authentication. You can find yours in [account settings](https://logokit.com/account/api-tokens).

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the logo to return. Allowed values are 64, 128, or 256. Default is 64px for free users, 128px for paid users. Set to 256px for high-resolution logos (paid users only).

parameters.name: fallback
parameters.description: Fallback behavior if the logo is not available. 'monogram': Returns a monogram image from the first letter of the domain (default). '404': Returns a 404 HTTP error.

200.description: Logo image found and returned as PNG.

404.description: Logo not found (only if `fallback=404` is used).

get.summary: Retrieve logo by stock ticker symbol
get.description: Returns the logo for the specified stock ticker as a PNG image. Free users: 64x64px. Paid users: 128x128px. Caching or local storage of images is not supported.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The stock ticker symbol for which to retrieve the logo. For example, AAPL. We support all major stock exchanges worldwide, including NYSE, NASDAQ, TSE, LSE, SZSE, Euronext, Deutsche Boerse and more.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Publishable API token for authentication. You can find yours in [account settings](https://logokit.com/account/api-tokens).

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the logo to return. Allowed values are 64, 128, or 256. Default is 64px for free users, 128px for paid users. Set to 256px for high-resolution logos (paid users only).

parameters.name: fallback
parameters.description: Fallback behavior if the logo is not available. 'monogram': Returns a monogram image from the first letter of the symbol (default). '404': Returns a 404 HTTP error.

200.description: Logo image found and returned as PNG.

404.description: Logo not found (only if `fallback=404` is used).

get.description: Returns the logo for the specified cryptocurrency as a PNG image. Free users: 64x64px. Paid users: 128x128px. Caching or local storage of images is not supported.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The cryptocurrency symbol for which to retrieve the logo. For example, BTC for Bitcoin or ETH for Ethereum. We support over 12,000 cryptocurrencies.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Publishable API token for authentication. You can find yours in [account settings](https://logokit.com/account/api-tokens).

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the logo to return. Allowed values are 64, 128, or 256. Default is 64px for free users, 128px for paid users. Set to 256px for high-resolution logos (paid users only).

parameters.name: fallback
parameters.description: Fallback behavior if the logo is not available. 'monogram': Returns a monogram image from the first letter of the symbol (default). '404': Returns a 404 HTTP error.

200.description: Logo image found and returned as PNG.

get.description: Returns comprehensive data about companies, including their address, domain, founding year, and number of employees. Available only for paid plans.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The domain or stock ticker for which you want to retrieve brand information. For example, apple.com or AAPL. We support all major stock exchanges worldwide.

200.description: Brand information found and returned as JSON.

404.description: Brand information not found for the specified identifier.

BearerAuth.description: Bearer token authentication. You must provide a valid **Secret API token** in the Authorization header of your request. You can find yours in your [account settings](https://logokit.com/account/api-tokens).
